results.title: Apollo 10: around the moon
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The film shows various footage of Apollo 10’s travel around the moon including: the Command module filmed from the Lunar module; the far side of the moon; Command module over landing site No. 2; view from Lunar module sixty miles up; inside the Lunar module; Lunar module descent and much more.

results.title: First Fleet: rite of passage
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, Michael Balson, Bill Leimbach, First Fleet Re-enactment Company and Orana Films
results.brief_description: Produced to commemorate Australia’s Bicentenary (1988), this video captures the official First Fleet Reenactment Voyage in 200 minutes of action and adventure. Witness the trials and tribulations of the modern day voyagers who took part in the voyage from Portsmouth on 13 May 1987 to the spectacular finale on Sydney Harbour on Australia Day, 26 January 1988.

results.title: The Hemp revolution
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clarke, Video Vision and Conscious Light
results.brief_description: This documentary proposes that the Hemp plant (Cannabis Sativa Marijuana) could be the solution to several of our major environmental problems. It would meen a shift from the present unsustainable, petrochemical-based economy towards a sustainable plant based economy. A move which could only occur if the drug was legalized. This programme covers the history and varied usage of the plant as well as alternative options in response to the “war on drugs”. Interviews feature Dr Andrew Weil, Dr Lester Grinspoon, Terence McKenna, Dr Kate Short, Professor Peter Dale Scott, Dr Andrew Katelaris and Gatewood Galbraith.

results.title: Amongst equals
results.creator_credit: Paul Hamfess, Tom Zubrycki and Jotz Productions
results.brief_description: Documents the history of the Australian Trade Union Movement. The film is not endorsed by the ACTU and represents only the film maker’s view. The 1850s saw the introduction of the eight hour labour movement and the subsequent development of the trade union movement. Unions were established to organise, assert and defend the worker’s rights, industrial awards, occupational health and safety and minimum wages.

results.title: Earthquake in Turkey
results.material_description: digital screen recording of @matemusic1's TikTok post
results.brief_description: The dramatic collapse of a building in the aftermath of the recent earthquake that devestated Turkey and Syria - or is it? While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one turns out to be a building losing its scaffolding in Japan several years ago. Unlike traditional news media where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responds to disasters immediately but randomly. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings were able to post about their situation, alerting friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
description_for_label:
The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.

results.title: Theremin: An Electronic Odyssey documentary poster
results.brief_description: Poster for the documentary ‘Theremin: An Electronic Odyssey.’ This documentary explores the life of Leon Theremin, the inventor of an electronic synthesizer called the theremin, which uses motion to produce a sliding ethereal sound. After creating the instrument, Theremin is kidnapped by the KGB to work on inventions and surveillance technology. During his absence, the theremin becomes a popular instrument in film scores and through the performances of Clara Rockmore. In 1991, Theremin finally returns to the United States after his release.

results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of ‘journey making’ the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Tramways
results.creator_credit: Michael Bau, Gunzel and Leonie Dickinson
results.brief_description: A warm hearted look at the people of Melbourne, their trams and their passion. Delves into the fascination with a mode of transport that carries passengers in the 19990’s on 1930’s vehicles.
results.description: A warm hearted look at the people of Melbourne, their trams and their passion. Delves into the fascination with a mode of transport that carries passengers in the 19990’s on 1930’s vehicles.
